The co-founder of Baba's Chicken is a 27-year-old student who is currently studying Financial Accounting at the University of Riverside. This young man's love for food was no random discovery, it was normal for him to spend countless hours scrolling through food pages for dinner inspiration. He has never had any formal culinary training by some fancy chef, he simply cooks for happy bellies.

When the co-founder was a child, he spent a lot of time hovering over his dad while he was preparing Sunday's BBQ. The co-founder was impressed with his dad's ability to never measure anything, yet he always knew exactly how much of each spice he needed. He stated that "My parents had a significant impact on my interest in food, and that's the primary reason I named my brand Baba's. I wanted it to reflect the  "Dad-on-the-Grill" tradition that we all grew up on."
